tn.ref: Who is a wise man? Who knows what the events in life mean?
tn.text: The writer asks these as leading questions to provide the answer in what he says next.

tn.ref: causes his face to shine
tn.text: This means that the person's face will show that he has wisdom. AT: "shows on his face" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the hardness of his face
tn.text: AT: "his harsh appearance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: God's oath to protect him
tn.text: "the oath you made before God to protect him"

tn.ref: Do not hurry out of his presence
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) do not be hasty to physically leave his presence or 2) to remain loyal to the King, do not hastily abandon him for another.

tn.ref: The king's word rules
tn.text: AT: "What the king says is the law" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: who will say to him
tn.text: AT: "no one can say to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: What are you doing?
tn.text: AT: "You should not be doing what you are doing." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: A wise man's heart recognizes
tn.text: the "heart" refers to thoughts. AT: "A wise man recognizes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Who can tell him what is coming?
tn.text: This question emphasizes that no one know what will happen in the future. AT: "No one can tell him what is coming." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: No one is ruler over his breath so as to stop the breath ... no one has power over the day of his death
tn.text: Just as no one has the ability to stop himself from breathing, no one can continue living when it is time to die. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: wickedness will not rescue those who are its slaves
tn.text: The writer speaks of wickedness as if it were a master who had slaves. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: applied my heart
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ecc:01:16|1:17]].

tn.ref: every kind of work that is done
tn.text: AT: "every kind of work that people do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the wicked buried publicly
tn.text: Evil people that died were given honorable burials. Implied was that their bodies should have been thrown onto the city refuse heap or such. AT: "people bury the wicked publicly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: They were taken from the holy area and buried and were praised by people
tn.text: AT: "People took them from the holy area and buried them and praised them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: When a sentence against an evil crime is not executed quickly
tn.text: AT: "When people in authority do not quickly execute a sentence against an evil crime" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: entices the hearts of human beings
tn.text: Here the word "heart" refers to the will. AT: "entices human beings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: a hundred times
tn.text: AT: "100 times" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: it will be well with those who respect God
tn.text: AT: "life will go well for those who respect God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: who respect God, who honor his presence
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and are combined for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: his life will not be prolonged
tn.text: AT: "God will not prolong his life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: His days are like a fleeting shadow
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) the writer compares the length of the wicked person's life to a shadow that passes quickly or 2) the quality or enjoyment of life is fleeting to a wicked person, there is no substance to his life. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: useless vapor
tn.text: "meaningless" or "futility". Things that happen but should not. Such as good things happening to wicked people and bad things happening to good people.

tn.ref: something else that is done on the earth
tn.text: AT: "something else that people do on the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: for all the days of his life that God has given him
tn.text: AT: "for as long as God allows him to live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: applied my heart
tn.text: to apply one's mind and understanding towards figuring out something. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:ecc:01:16|1:17]].

tn.ref: the work that is done on the earth
tn.text: AT: "the work that people do on the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: without sleep for the eyes
tn.text: AT: "without sleeping" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: the work that is done under the sun
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "the work that God does under the sun" or 2) "the work that God allows people to do under the sun." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
